Class InputChecker

java.lang.Object
edu.handong.csee.java.hw5.util.InputChecker
public class InputChecker extends Object
This class checks if the input values are valid. It prints error messages when the input is wrong.

    static void
    printErrorMesssageForNegativeInputsAndExit(String engineName)
    This method prints an error message if an input value is negative.
    static void
    printErrorMesssageForTheNumberOfRequiredInputsAndExit(String engineName, int numOfRequiredInputs)
    This method prints an error message if the number of inputs is not enough.

  • Method Details

    • printErrorMesssageForTheNumberOfRequiredInputsAndExit

      public static void printErrorMesssageForTheNumberOfRequiredInputsAndExit(String engineName, int numOfRequiredInputs)
      This method prints an error message if the number of inputs is not enough. Then, the program stops.
      Parameters:
      engineName - The name of the engine.
      numOfRequiredInputs - The number of inputs that the engine needs.

    • printErrorMesssageForNegativeInputsAndExit

      public static void printErrorMesssageForNegativeInputsAndExit(String engineName)
      This method prints an error message if an input value is negative. Then, the program stops.
      Parameters:
      engineName - The name of the engine.
